elements.content:
➔ Practice using HTML by creating HTML content for a personal website
➔ Will add text, videos, images, links, etc.
➔ Covers concepts and tags that were discussed in the week 1 HTML presentation

<!DOCTYPE html>
<html>
	<head>
	</head>

	<body>
	<!-- All future content goes here -->
	</body>
</html>

So, to kick things off, let’s create two components called addItem.jsx and itemList.jsx and import them into our project. 
[[h3]]Explanation[[/]]
➔ The previous lines of code just create a blank page for us to work with
➔ <!DOCTYPE html> specifies that we are writing code in HTML
➔ The <html></html> blocks wrap our main HTML code
➔ The <head></head> blocks will wrap any links or browser descriptions we want to add
➔ Finally, the <body></body> is where we will be placing all our future examples
➔ This is what actually gets displayed on the screen

correct.onerror: Your code should include the doctype html tag!
Your code should include a starting html tag!
Your code should include a closing html tag!
Your code should include a starting body tag!
Your code should include a closing body tag!
Your code should include a starting head tag!
Your code should include a closing head tag!

elements.content:
My Website

Here is my website.

My name is _____.
My favorite color is _____.

My favorite food is _____.

This is my website

[[h3]]Explanation[[/]] ➔ Division tag to group the related tags for the website heading (apply
for following sections as well) ➔ Fill in the blanks with information you want to include (name, favorite food, color) ➔ Adds line breaks (
) to space the lines and
for a horizontal line

correct.onerror: Your code should include a starting h1 tag!
Your code should include a closing h1 tag!
Your code should include a starting h3 tag!
Your code should include a closing h3 tag!
Your code should include a starting p tag!
Your code should include a closing p tag!
Your code should include line breaks!

elements.content:
[[h3]]Explanation[[/]]
➔ Wraps an unordered list using the <ul> tags around <li> tags - place any three colors
➔ Wraps an ordered list using the <ol> tags around <li> tags - place your top three favorite foods in order

correct.onerror: Your code should include a starting ul tag!
Your code should include a closing ul tag!
Your code should include a starting ol tag!
Your code should include a closing ol tag!
Your code should include a starting li tag!
Your code should include a closing li tag!

elements.content:
Go to Google (Same Page)

Go to Google (New Tab)

[[h3]]Explanation[[/]]
➔ Add a hyperlink to another website of your choice (ex. google)
➔ Use line breaks in between
➔ Add another hyperlink to the same or another website, but include the target attribute to open it in a new tab

correct.onerror: Your code should include a starting <a> tag!
Your code should include a closing <a> tag!

elements.content:
[[h3]]Explanation[[/]]
➔ Add an image from either a web URL or your local directory (download an image of your choice and put it in your project directory or a separate folder for images)
➔ Embed a youtube video of your choice into the website (pick a size for your image and video by changing the width and height attributes to whatever fits best for your website)

correct.onerror: Your code should include a starting <iframe> tag!
Your code should include a closing <iframe> tag!
